annonstext:
Who are we?
Volvo Cars is a company on a mission; to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable and smart future.
Since 1927, we have been a brand known for our commitment to safety, creating innovative cars that make life less complicated for our consumers. In 2010, we decided to transform our business, resulting in a totally new generation of cars and technologies, as well as steady growth and record sales. Today, we’re expanding our global footprint in Europe, China and the US, and we’re on the lookout for new talent. 
We are constantly pushing our own skills and abilities to drive change in the automobile industry like never before. We are looking for innovative, committed people to join us in this endeavour and create safe, sustainable and connected cars. We believe in the power of people and will challenge and support you to reach your full potential. Join us and be part of Volvo Cars’ journey into the future.

What´s in it for you?
You will work within and benefit from the experience of Insight Lab, Volvo Cars expert team for everything related to Graph Technologies (Graph Data Management, Graph Analytics, Graph Visualization and more). Insight Lab support many graph-powered projects running throughout the company and develop Volvo Cars own Knowledge Graph and Graph Intelligence Platform (UNIFY).
What you will do?
As a summer intern you will develop tutorials, documentation and a dedicated icon database for UNIFY. Part of your task is also to develop Insight Lab’s website and other types of communication material. You will learn to use the tools developed by the team in great details to be able to recommend the best solutions for improving Insight Lab’s communication toolbox.
Do you fit the profile?
We are looking for candidates with ongoing Master level studies. You need to be interested in technology and love creating communication material and digital content (such as icons, gifs, illustrations, etc.). We want you to be customer oriented, a great communicator and show attention to details.
The internship requires you to be on site at the office in Gothenburg.

Location: Gothenburg, Sweden.
Duration
Period for summer internship is between 1 June – 31 August 2021, max 10 weeks. Start and end time to be discussed with recruiting manager. The internship is paid.
How to learn more and apply?
Does this sound like an exciting summer internship?
Welcome with your application by submitting your resume and cover letter via the link below no later than 25nd of March 2021. Interviews will be held continuously.
Please note that applications via email will not be accepted due to GDPR.

If you have any questions regarding the position you are welcome to contact FIRSTNAME LASTNAME  at  EMAIL 
For questions about the recruitment process, please contact Lisa Hallvin at  EMAIL
